newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul stocks seen deepening consolidation.
newsitem.headline: Seoul stocks seen deepening consolidation.

text.p: Consolidation of South Korean stocks is expected to spread across the board on Tuesday with many investors sitting tight on the sidelines, brokers said.
"Yesterday's rebound in some large-cap shares was just technical. The consolidation will extend to smaller-cap shares today, pushing the index further down," said Park Sang-jae at Coryo Securities.
The stock index closed on Monday 764.45, down 2.82 points.
Brokers said there were some worries about possible losses following the devaulation of several Asian currencies.
Margin loans, which now exceed customer deposits, also depressed investor sentiment.
Song Tae-seung at Dongsuh Securities said he was concerned about the planned temporary suspension of production by the three chipmakers and labour uncertainty in the car and shipbuilding industries.
"It would be wise to take a conservative investment attitude," Song said.
